summary:
As a senior data scientist, I am accomplished in processing and analyzing diverse sets of data, applying machine learning techniques, and finding AI-solutions. I like programming, I am fond of problem solving, and I am fascinated by emerging technologies. 

My background is in "Physics and Astronomy" at the University of Groningen. I obtained my PhD in theoretical astrophysics with specific knowledge in magnetohydrodynamic simulations and the theories of star-forming regions. I continued to become a senior scientist in astrochemistry at the Max Planck Institute in Munich. 

For the past 6 years, I have been working in the field of Data Science with projects such as predictive modeling, data analysis, crime prevention, predicting health, computer vision, activity pattern recognition, data mining, dashboarding, webscraping, and various topics using text analytics and NLP. Next to technical skills, I also provide advice and guidance to data driven projects, present data science topics, coordinate data science labs, and supervise master students. In addition, a major part of my time is spent on acquiring and setting-up new projects. In summary, I am an all-round Data Scientist.

While I like working individually, I often lead projects and work with people from various backgrounds and expertises. I have the perseverance and pragmatism to solve complex problems, whether theoretical or practical in nature, and achieve my desired goals with high energy.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

awards.title: World Bank RSB
awards.description: Awarded the World Bank Research Support Budget (RSB) grant of 93k for a follow-up work we performed in collaboration with the World Bank LSMS team.

awards.title: WeCare project
awards.description: Joint effort of Tilburg University and ETZ (Elisabeth-TweeSteden Hospital) to give researches a starting grant for innovative projects. Our project, with CentERdata as one of the collaborators in a large consortium, is related to predicting trauma severity and forecasting the potential consequences of the newly admitted (trauma) people using data science and machine learning techniques.

awards.title: Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR)
awards.description: The SBIR competition is the way in which the Dutch government challenges entrepreneurs through an innovation competition to come up with innovative products and services to solve social issues. I was granted this SBIR award with our innovative project Smart Street Scan, an AI-tool to automatically detect, classify and register street waste for future improvements on infrastructure and optimize cleaning routes for municipalities.

awards.title: Seal of Excellence
awards.description: Certificate deilvered by the European Commission as the institution managing Horizon 2020, the EU framework Programme for Research and Innovation. For the project proposal entitled "CSI-ICES" applied as part of the Marie Sklodowska-Curie actions.

awards.title: Computing Grant
awards.description: Proposal was awarded supercomputing time of 0.8 million hours.

awards.title: Press release
awards.description: Press coverage of "Kleine stofdeeltjes cruciaal voor de vorming van zware sterren" In Dutch national newspapers.

awards.title: Press release
awards.description: Press coverage of "Superzware zwarte gaten stimuleren de vorming van zware sterren" in Dutch national newspapers and on live radio.

awards.title: Press release
awards.description: Press coverage of "Gigantische kosmische rivier bij quasar in kaart gebracht" and "Quasar produceert langste stroom van geladen deeltjes in het heelal" in Dutch national newspapers and on live radio.

awards.title: Academic Year Prize
awards.description: First prize awarded for our project as the best project for communicating science to the public.

projects.title: Meting Stemlokalen
projects.description: Analyzing counts, types, locations, and accessibility of polling stations (Stemlokalen) for various Dutch elections since 2022.

projects.title: Inspiration sessions
projects.description: Organizing inspiration sessions for companies who want to be more data driven. Inspiration sessions are related to data scince and articifial intelligence. They consist of inspirational talks, outlining related projects by explaining pitfalls and successes, and brainstorm sessions.

projects.title: Webscraping with a purpose
projects.description: Webscraping of publicly accessible websites for auditing, research, and governmental regulation agencies. Webscraping is the extraction of information and the collection of data from websites and other online sources. Information from thousands of websites can be gathered, organized, and put in databases in a fraction of time manual labor can achieve, thus saving a lot of time and money.

projects.title: Risicotaxatietool bedrijventerreinen
projects.description: In opdracht van de provincies Noord-Brabant en Gelderland gaat het om een project om kwetsbare bedrijventerreinen te identificeren op het gebied van georganiseerde criminaliteit en ondermijning. Hiervoor hebben we een risicotaxatietool ontwikkeld dat gebruik maakt van machine learning modellen voor drie soorten ondermijnende criminaliteit: drugs, witwassen, en mensenhandel.

projects.title: JRC project on proving the existence of economies of scope on data aggregation
projects.description: The classic economic interpretation of economies of scope refers to cost savings in the re-use of data for other purposes. Here, we introduce another interpretation of economies of scope, in data aggregation. It refers to improvements in prediction accuracy when the number of complementary variables in a dataset increases. For this purpose we create an aggregated data pool of health and health-related variables and run machine learning models to predict health outcomes. Our findings confirm the existence of economies of scope in the aggregation of health and healthrelated variables in order to improve the prediction accuracy of health outcomes.

projects.title: World Bank project on predicting time use data using wearables in low-income contexts
projects.description: Obtaining data on people’s time use can be difficult and costly. Especially in rural communities, where our knowledge is limited to a handful of studies, policies can benefit from more information. With this project we investigated whether it was possible to predict people’s time use, categorized into 25 broad group activities, using sensor signal data captured by an accelerometer device. Using machine learning-techniques, we build a supervised classification model on the time use activities and the physical activity data in order to predict the performed activity. Our findings prove the feasibility of predicting time use activities as well as provide us with ideas for improved data collection to build better models.

projects.title: We Care: Voorspellen van traumauitkomsten
projects.description: Via machine learning modellen kunnen we traumauitkomsten voorspellen. Dat wil zeggen of patienten het zullen overleven of na opname in een ziekenhuis. De modellen zijn een verbetering van het al bestaande Trauma Injury Severity Score (TRISS) model.

projects.title: Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for thousands of businessreports
projects.description: Companies have to submit yearly reports (jaarverslagen), whcih are availabe online. To extract information from these (scanned) PDFs that can go back decades is a massive undertaking. A key aspect is to extract information with high accuracy, especially from older PDFs. This project focusses on obtaining relevant and useful information from these PDFs in an automized way.

projects.title: Search Engine Experiment - Comparing SERPs of various SEs for use in SEO
projects.description: Search engines (SEs) are generally our gateway to the internet. They guide us in our path to information and help us to find the things we want. Search engines have a big impact in what we see, choose, and learn. But search engines are also highly dynamic in their search results. Search engine result pages (SERPs) are continually changing, more so for recent queries than for relatively old and static queries. Assessing the dynamic behaviour of search engines for various types of queries is important for better understanding search engine optimization (SEO) is one of our main goals of this work. This work is done for the German Federal Ministry of Finance.

projects.title: Sligro Data Science Lab (SDSL) coordinator
projects.description: Coordinator of the Sligro Data Science Lab. Duties involve translating ideas into data science projects, acquire students, coordinate the thesis projects with industry demands, organize meetings, and prepare & start projects smoothly. In some cases, also supervising students was necessary.

projects.title: Fraud Detection in the fisheries sector
projects.description: Finding indicators of fraud and the prevention of fraud in the fishing industry. A project carried out for the National Food and Wares Authority (NVWA) of the ministry of Agriculture, Nature and Food Quality (LNV).

projects.title: Smart Street Scan - An image recognition (computer vision) project
projects.description: Keeping public space clean is an important core task for municipalities. Advanced AI technology can help a lot in this regard. With Smart Street Scan, our aim was to automatically scan public space using sensor and camera technology. Litter is thus quickly identified, classified and registered via image recognition. We employ Yolo.v3, a CNN based deep learning algorithm to classsify various kinds of non-biodegradable waste. This project is done in collaboration with the municipality of Utrecht (gemeente Utrecht).

projects.title: Big Data Hackathon - event
projects.description: Main organizer of the Big Data Hackathon "Hack for Future Talent" on Education/Talent Optimization for the municipalities Tilburg and Eindhoven.

projects.title: Indicators of Crime and Subversion
projects.description: The objective was to determine the state of an industrial area concerning the occurrence and development of (organized) crime and subversion. This project was commissioned by WODC (Research and Documentation Centre of the Ministry of Justice and Security) and is carried out in cooperation with the Expertisecentrum Veiligheid (Center of Expertise on Security) of Avans University of Applied Sciences and the Data Science Center (DSC/t) of Tilburg University.

profile_positions.description: As a senior data scientist, I am involved in projects related to preventing crime and subversion, predicting health and trauma outcomes, image recognition in the public sector, activity detection using sensor signals, data exploration and visualization, webscraping, and various topics using text analytics and NLP. Networking and aquiring new clients is an important part of my duties. In addition, I mentor master students and regularly advise and guide companies on setting up data-driven projects.
profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: I am a part of the data science team that collaborates with other researchers in the field of applied machine learning and AI, in addition to working with and creating new insights in big data systems. Centerdata is located at the campus of Tilburg University (TiU) and has strong ties to the various analytical departmets of TiU as well as the Data Science Center Tilburg and the Jheronimus Academy of Data Science (JADS).
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

company.name: Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics

profile_positions.company: Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics
profile_positions.description: Combining magnetohydrodynamic codes with detailed chemical models at the Center for Astrochemical Studies (CAS). This involved a lot of scientific programming and output data analysis. My main focus area was to understand the role of solid-state chemistry on the evolution of molecular clouds through the impact on thermodynamics, and vice versa, by tracing the chemical abundances. These methods involved the understanding of molecular abundance sensitivity to the underlying chemical and physical processes.
profile_positions.title: Astrochemist / Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description: Studying the role of surface chemistry and its relation to the theories of star formation. The process of freeze-out, chemical desorption, and the chemical impact on cloud thermodynamics was investigated. Analyzing Tera-scale data and visualizing supercomputer simulation output was part of the fulfilled tasks.
profile_positions.title: Astrophysicist / Postdoctoral Scholar

profile_positions.description: The doctorate degree on the project "The IMF in active Galaxies" was obtained with the thesis entitled "The Origin of Stars: Tales from the Unexpected in Extreme Environments"​. During the PhD, I worked with large datasets (analyzing and visualizing), familiarized myself with several programming languages (Python, Fortran, IDL), and focused on many astrophysical processes (turbulence, thermodynamics, hydrodynamics, gravity, magnetic fields). The main goal was to test the Universality of the Initial Mass Function (IMF), which was found to be non-Universal in extreme environments.
profile_positions.title: Doctor of Philosophy (PhD)

profile_positions.description:
TA for various courses.
1) Radiative processes in Astrophysics, Master's course, 2009
2) Spectroscopy of the Solar Corona & Beta1op1, Project mentor, 2005-2006
3) Orientatie Natuurkunde (Physics 101), Bachelor's course, 2002-2003
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: For about a year, I was a lab technician at Zeolyst C.V., a producer of the mineral zeolite for use in petrochemical industry. This was after I obtained my master's degree, but before starting my PhD. I also worked as an intern at the same company for 10 months in 1999-2000.
profile_positions.title: Chemical Analyst

Guiding three MSc students with their Thesis projects. Topics are based on Deep Learning (DL), that is, Generative Adversarial Networks (GAN), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), and Image Recognition (Computer Vision).
